1. Harris campaign trolls Trump by playing chicken sounds over footage of him appearing to back out of debate  The Independent
  2. Why Harris wants to unmute Trump  CNN
  3. Trump Suggests Debate Rules Are Set. Harris’s Team Says Otherwise.  The New York Times
  4. Harris campaign rejects Trump claim on agreement over hot mics for Sept. 10 debate  Reuters.com
  5. Don Lemon: Trump campaign unsure what to do with Harris  The Hill

item.title: US and UN call for talks in Libyan dispute over control of central bank
item.description:
UN-backed institutions in west of Libya show no sign of backing down over dismissal of bank’s governor of 20 years

A crisis in the Libyan economy sparked by an escalating and sometimes violent contest over the control of the country’s central bank can only be cured through diplomacy, the US embassy in Libya has said, as it backed efforts by the UN to convene an emergency meeting of the groups involved.

The embassy, led by the ambassador Richard Norland, pleaded with all sides to heed a UN call to hold talks, saying the contest over the administration of the bank “undermines confidence in Libya’s economic and financial stability in the eyes of Libyan citizens and the international community, and increases the likelihood of harmful confrontation”.

Continue reading...

item.title: What do Woolworths and Big W’s starkly different results tell us about Australia’s competition problems?
item.description:
Amid a cost-of-living crisis, essential goods sectors like supermarkets, energy and banking have reported strong results – and a lack of competition is at the root

  • Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates
  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

If you want to understand the competition problems in Australia’s corporate sector, take a look at the annual results delivered by Woolworths.

Best known for running the country’s biggest chain of supermarkets, Woolworths also owns the discount department store Big W, and the results from those two businesses couldn’t be more starkly different.

Sign up for Guardian Australia’s breaking news email
